title: Meta’s new move: What are Community Notes and can they really replace fact-checkers? - The Indian Express
summary:
Meta’s new move: What are Community Notes and can they really replace fact-checkers?

Date: January 7, 2023 | Source: Indian Express

Meta's recent decision to discontinue its independent fact-checking program in the US has caused significant backlash and raised discussions about the company's strategy against misinformation.

  • The 'Community Notes' system will replace traditional fact-checking, similar to Twitter's model.
  • This shift follows criticisms of bias in expert fact-checking from Meta.
  • Officials from the International Fact-Checking Network contend that Meta's decision undermines unbiased reporting.
  • Community Notes will allow users to contribute helpful context to posts, improving with public engagement.
  • The approach aims to prevent bias by requiring diverse participation in ratings.
  • Challenges remain, including the potential for manipulation and capturing nuanced misinformation.
“Experts, like everyone else, have their own biases and perspectives.” – Meta's Blog Post

Meta's move to Community Notes could signify a broader shift in content moderation, but the effectiveness in combating misinformation remains uncertain.
newTitle: Meta Shifts from Fact-Checking to Community Notes: Implications and Analysis

title: 2025 Bajaj Pulsar RS200 Launched In India Priced At Rs 1.84 Lakh - NDTV
summary:
2025 Bajaj Pulsar RS200 Launched In India Priced At Rs 1.84 Lakh

Publication Date: Not available Source: Not available

Bajaj Auto has launched the 2025 iteration of the Pulsar RS200 in the Indian market at a starting price of Rs 1.84 lakh (ex-showroom). This is the only fully-faired bike in the brand's lineup and features a 200 cc engine.

  • This launch continues the Pulsar legacy as the bike was initially launched in 2015.
  • Design aspects include twin-projector LED headlamps and sharp fairing lines for an aggressive look.
  • Features an updated LCD instrument cluster with Bluetooth connectivity and navigation capabilities.
  • Offers three riding modes: Rain, Off-road, and Road.
  • Equipped with telescopic front suspension and a Nitrox mono shock absorber at the rear.
  • Powered by a 200 cc liquid-cooled engine producing 24 hp and 18.74 Nm of torque.
  • The bike utilizes a six-speed transmission with an assist and slipper clutch for smoother gear shifts.
newTitle: 2025 Bajaj Pulsar RS200 Launched In India Priced At Rs 1.84 Lakh

title: IREDA Q3 Results Live Updates: IREDA share price ends 3.5% lower ahead of earnings today; asset quality eyed | Stock Market News - Mint
Adani Wilmar's OFS for 20% stake opens January 10, floor price Rs 275 per share - Moneycontrol
summary:
Adani Wilmar's OFS for 20% stake opens January 10, floor price Rs 275 per share

Date: January 09, 2025

Source: Moneycontrol

Adani Commodities is set to sell up to 20% of its stake in Adani Wilmar through an Offer For Sale (OFS) commencing on January 10, with a floor price of Rs 275 per share.

  • OFS will involve a base offer of 13.5% equity with a green shoe option for another 6.5% share.
  • The sale includes 17.54 crore shares, reserving 25% for mutual funds and insurance companies.
  • Multiple brokers are facilitating the OFS, including ICICI Securities and Jefferies.
  • Shares of Adani Wilmar are currently trading at Rs 324, down 13% from last year.
"Adani Commodities LLP will be selling 17.54 crore shares as the Base Offer on January 10 and 13."

The upcoming OFS represents a strategic move for Adani Commodities, aiming to restructure its equity distribution while providing investment opportunities to stakeholders.
newTitle: Adani Wilmar to Offer 20% Stake at Rs 275 per Share Starting January 10

title: MG M9 MPV To Make India Debut At Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025 - NDTV
Tata Elxsi reports 3.6% decline in net profit on-year to Rs 199 crore, revenue rises 2.7% - Moneycontrol
summary:
Tata Elxsi reports 3.6% decline in net profit on-year to Rs 199 crore, revenue rises 2.7%

Date: January 09, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Tata Elxsi reported a 3.6% decline in net profit for the December 2024 quarter, despite a rise in revenue. The company attributed the profit decline to geopolitical uncertainty and industry-specific challenges.

  • Net profit declined to Rs 199 crore from Rs 206.43 crore a year ago.
  • Revenue from operations increased to Rs 939.17 crore, a slight decrease from Rs 955.1 crore in the previous quarter.
  • EBITDA fell by 7.7% to Rs 220.07 crore, with a margin decrease from 25.7% to 24.2%.
  • The decline is attributed to geopolitical uncertainty, currency volatility, and challenges in Europe and the US.
“The company attributed decline to geopolitical uncertainty, currency volatility and industry specific challenges in Europe and US.”

This report highlights Tata Elxsi's challenging quarter despite a slight growth in revenue, reflecting broader market uncertainties.
newTitle: Tata Elxsi Reports Decline in Net Profit Amid Revenue Increase

title: Watch | ‘How long can you stare at your wife?’: L&T chairman wants employees to work on Sundays too, sparks outrage - The Indian Express
summary:
‘How long can you stare at your wife?’: L&T chairman wants employees to work on Sundays too, sparks outrage

Published on: January 9, 2025, Source: Indian Express

In a now-viral video, Larsen & Toubro Chairman SN Subrahmanyan has ignited a storm of criticism for suggesting employees should work 90 hours a week, including Sundays.

  • Subrahmanyan joked about employees staring at their wives instead of working and criticized the inability to require Sunday work.
  • Comments drew backlash and comparisons to Narayana Murthy’s controversial 70-hour workweek suggestion.
  • Critics highlighted L&T's corporate culture, questioning the treatment of employees and work-life balance in India.
  • The debate ties into broader discussions on work expectations in India's private sector, with contrasting views from leaders like Infosys founder Narayana Murthy and Swiggy CEO Rohit Kapoor.
“How long will you stare at your wife?” L&T chairman wants you to work on Sundays also!

This comment has reinvigorated conversations about the need for a healthy work-life balance amid growing pressures on employees in corporate settings.
newTitle: L&T Chairman Sparks Outrage Over Comments on Sunday Working

title: TCS Q3 Results: Profit rises 12% YoY to Rs 12,380 crore, in-line with estimates - The Economic Times
summary:
TCS Q3 Results: Profit rises 12% YoY to Rs 12,380 crore, in-line with estimates

Publication Date: Thursday

Source: Economic Times

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) reported a 12% increase in consolidated net profit for Q3, reaching Rs 12,380 crore, in line with market estimates. The revenue stood at Rs 63,973 crore, a 5.6% increase year-on-year, though slightly below expectations.

  • Interim dividend announced: Rs 10 per share
  • Special dividend: Rs 66 per share
  • Total Contract Value (TCV) for the quarter: $10.2 billion
  • Operating margin: 24.5% (down 50 bps YoY)
  • Net cash from operations: Rs 13,032 crore (105.3% of net income)
“BFSI and CBG returning to growth... gives us confidence for the future,” said CEO K Krithivasan.

This quarter’s results reflect TCS's strong positioning for long-term growth despite seasonal challenges.
newTitle: TCS Q3 Results: Profit rises 12% YoY to Rs 12,380 crore, in-line with estimates

title: Sensex, Nifty 50 fall for second consecutive session. What is driving Indian stock market down? Explained with 5 factors | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Sensex, Nifty 50 fall for second consecutive session. What is driving Indian stock market down? Explained with 5 factors

Date: January 9
Source: Live Mint

In a continuation of a downward trend, the Indian stock market's benchmarks, Sensex and Nifty 50, have declined in response to a combination of weak global cues and internal economic challenges.

The recent decline can be attributed to five key factors impacting investor sentiment:

  • Q3 earnings in focus: Investors await upcoming earnings reports, creating caution in the markets.
  • Rising US bond yields and dollar: Increased bond yields are steering foreign capital away from emerging markets.
  • Heavy selling by FPIs: Foreign portfolio investors are retreating amid concerns over trade policies and interest rates.
  • Macro jitters: Economic growth concerns are significantly affecting investor risk appetite.
  • Uncertainty over US Federal Reserve policies: Speculations about inflation and policy adjustments are causing apprehension.
"The recent fall in the Indian stock market can be attributed to several interconnected factors..." - Atul Parakh, CEO of Bigul

As the situation unfolds, investors are advised to be cautious due to the prevailing market uncertainties.
newTitle: Understanding the Decline of Sensex and Nifty 50: Key Factors Explained

title: Govt plans to give LPG subsidy worth Rs 35,000 cr to IOC, BPCL, and HPCL - Business Standard
summary:
Government Plans Rs 35,000 Crore LPG Subsidy for IOC, BPCL, HPCL

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Industry Reports

The Indian government is set to provide a Rs 35,000 crore subsidy to state-owned oil companies to compensate for their losses on the sale of domestic LPG, as they have maintained prices amidst rising raw material costs.

  • The companies affected include Indian Oil Corporation Ltd (IOC), Bharat Petroleum Corporation Ltd (BPCL), and Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd (HPCL).
  • Domestic LPG prices have been held at Rs 803 per 14.2-kg cylinder since March 2024 despite higher costs, resulting in significant under-recoveries.
  • The total estimated under-recovery for the LPG sector in the current fiscal year is about Rs 40,500 crore.
  • A government provision for this subsidy is expected to be included in the Union Budget for the 2025-26 fiscal year.
  • Previous compensations of Rs 22,000 crore were also provided to these companies for the fiscal years 2021-22 and 2022-23.
“There is an under-recovery of about Rs 240 per 14.2-kg cylinder that the state-owned fuel retailers sell to domestic households.”

This subsidy aims to alleviate the financial strain on these companies and ensure the sustainability of LPG supplies to households.
newTitle: Government Plans Rs 35,000 Crore LPG Subsidy for IOC, BPCL, HPCL

Equity fund inflows jump 15% to Rs 41,156 cr in Dec, SIP book tops Rs 26,000 cr mark: AMFI - Moneycontrol
summary:
Equity fund inflows jump 15% to Rs 41,156 cr in Dec, SIP book tops Rs 26,000 cr mark: AMFI

Date: January 09, 2025

Source: Moneycontrol

Open-ended equity mutual fund inflows surged by 14.5 percent over the last month to Rs 41,155.91 crore in December, with thematic/sectoral and small-cap funds attracting higher investments. The SIP contributions reached an all-time high of Rs 26,459 crore.

  • Overall open-ended mutual funds saw net outflows of Rs 80,509.20 crore in December.
  • Equity fund inflows were up 15% compared to the previous period.
  • SIP contributions topped Rs 26,000 crore for the first time.
  • Venkat Chalasani, Chief Executive of AMFI, highlighted the growing maturity of investors.
“Despite volatile market conditions, equity-oriented schemes continued to see strong inflows, reflecting investors’ confidence and commitment to stay invested for the long term.” - Venkat Chalasani

This significant rise in inflows suggests a robust investor confidence in equity markets, despite external volatility.
newTitle: Equity Fund Inflows Surge 15% in December, SIP Contributions Reach New Heights

title: 'I Regret I Am Not Able To Make You Work On Sundays': L&T Chief Calls For 90-Hour Work Week - News18
Swiggy to launch Instamart as separate app, eyes multi-app strategy on quick commerce boom - Moneycontrol
summary:
Swiggy to launch Instamart as separate app, eyes multi-app strategy on quick commerce boom

Date: January 09, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Food and grocery delivery platform Swiggy will launch its quick commerce offering Instamart as a separate app aimed at evolving customer preferences, according to group CEO and co-founder Sriharsha Majety.

  • Swiggy looks to build a multi-app strategy, similar to models by Meituan and Alibaba.
  • Instamart will also remain available on the main Swiggy app.
  • CEO Sriharsha Majety states that Instamart could potentially surpass food delivery in user base.
“We are in an unchartered territory and we are taking a zero-based view of the market.” - Sriharsha Majety

This launch reflects Swiggy's efforts to adapt to a rapidly changing market landscape.
newTitle: Swiggy Launches Instamart as a Separate App to Enhance Quick Commerce Strategy

Bad news for Tata Group as hours after Noel Tata's daughters Maya Tata, Leah Tata elevation, two trustees... - India.com
summary:
Bad news for Tata Group as hours after Noel Tata’s daughters Maya Tata, Leah Tata elevation, two trustees...

Date: Not specified Source: India.com

Maya and Leah Tata, daughters of Noel Tata, have been appointed to the Board of Trustees of SRTII, prompting disagreements among outgoing trustees over the resignation process.

  • Maya and Leah Tata have joined the board of the Sir Ratan Tata Industrial Institute.
  • This marks the first formal role for Noel Tata’s children in the Tata Trusts.
  • Their induction has caused internal strife, with former trustee Arnaz Kotwal expressing dissatisfaction with her resignation.
  • SRTII focuses on training underprivileged women and has experienced a shift in leadership during a generational transition within the Tata group.
“I was blindsided by this communication from a virtual stranger under the direction of his CEO.” - Arnaz Kotwal

The appointment of Maya and Leah Tata represents a significant generational shift within the Tata Group.
newTitle: Bad news for Tata Group as Noel Tata’s daughters take positions on the board

Markets extend losses: NIFTY50 traded below 23550, SENSEX falls 440 points, LT, HDFC Bank and ONGC among top losers - Upstox
summary:
Markets extend losses: NIFTY50 traded below 23550, SENSEX falls 440 points, LT, HDFC Bank and ONGC among top losers

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Not specified

Domestic equity indices have continued to decline as investors offload holdings in major stocks, significantly impacting the Sensex and Nifty indices.

  • Trading conditions led to losses in Larsen & Toubro, Tata Steel, Tata Motors, HDFC Bank, and Ultratech Cement.
  • The Sensex and Nifty fell below psychological levels of 77,800 and 23,600, respectively.
  • U.S. Treasury yield reaches its highest level since April, indicating growing inflation concerns.
  • Asian markets mostly trade in the red amid fears regarding delayed policy easing from the Federal Reserve.
  • Sensex closed at 77,758.40, down 390.09 points (0.50%).
  • NIFTY50 ended at 23,560.10, down 128.85 points (0.54%).

“Market participants were cautious as the 10-year U.S. Treasury yield rose to its highest since April.”

The sustained decline in equity markets reflects a cautious sentiment among investors, influenced by global economic indicators and inflationary pressures.
newTitle: Domestic Equity Markets Experience Significant Losses Amid Inflation Concerns

title: Stock Market Live Updates 9 January 2025: Sensex, Nifty fall amid sustained selling pressure, dragged by banking stocks - BusinessLine
summary:
Stock Market Live Updates 9 January 2025: Sensex, Nifty fall amid sustained selling pressure, dragged by banking stocks

Date: January 9, 2025

Source: The Hindu BusinessLine

The Indian equity markets experienced a significant decline with the Sensex dropping over 500 points due to heavy selling pressure, particularly in the banking sector, amid negative sentiment from foreign institutional investors.

  • As of 1 p.m., Sensex decreased by 492.47 points (0.63%) to 77,656.02.
  • Nifty fell by 157.85 points (0.67%) to 23,531.10.
  • Foreign Institutional Investors offloaded ₹3,362 crore worth of equities, amplifying market pressure.
  • ONGC led declines on the NSE while Hindustan Unilever managed to gain amid the broader market drop.
“The Nifty is being closely watched at the key support level of 23,500, crucial for future market direction.”

In conclusion, today's market shift reflects growing concerns over global economic conditions and investor sentiment, highlighting the banking sector's pivotal role in market movements.
newTitle: Stock Market Updates: Sensex and Nifty Decline Amid Banking Sector Struggles

title: Meta’s fact-checking snub in US sets off alarm bells for fact-checkers in India - The Indian Express
summary:
Meta’s fact-checking snub in US sets off alarm bells for fact-checkers in India

Publication Date: January 9, 2025

Source: The Indian Express

Meta's recent decision to end its third-party fact-checking programme in the US has raised alarm bells for fact-checkers in India, as many rely on funding from Meta, fearing they could face significant operational challenges.

  • Meta announced the cessation of its third-party fact-checking programme in the U.S., pivoting to a community-driven model.
  • Fact-checkers in India fear potential funding cuts, as many rely on Meta for financial support.
  • The survival of these fact-checking entities is threatened if they cannot access Meta's platforms for visibility.
  • Meta works with 12 fact-checking partners in India, including notable organizations and smaller firms.
  • Uncertainty looms over whether Meta will implement similar changes in India.
“This is possibly the biggest existential threat many fact checkers will have to contend with,” a senior executive from a fact-checking organisation stated anonymously.

The shift in Meta's strategy underscores the growing concerns about the future of independent fact-checking, especially in developing contexts like India.
newTitle: Meta’s Fact-Checking Shift Raises Concerns for India

summary:
Top Buzzing Stocks of the Day: GTPL Hathway, SRF, Navin Fluorine, and More

Date: January 9, 2024

Source: Upstox

The stock market experienced declines with notable movements in several stocks today, particularly in the chemicals and technology sectors.

  • SRF and Navin Fluorine saw significant increases of up to 15% due to rising prices for refrigerant gases.
  • MobiKwik reported a net loss in its recent earnings but saw a revenue increase of 42.8%.
  • GTPL Hathway shares rose over 12% as the company prepared to announce its quarterly results.
  • Borosil Renewables plans a 50% capacity expansion in solar glass manufacturing and hit a 5% circuit limit.
  • Manappuram Finance shares surged following the lifting of RBI restrictions on a subsidiary.
  • Swiggy shares rallied over 6% as Bernstein issued a positive outlook on its valuations.
“Swiggy's current valuations seem reasonable, with the potential for its shares to re-rate.” - Bernstein

This trading session highlighted the volatility in the markets with several stocks showing significant gains despite the overall negative trend.

title: Equity MF inflows rose 15% to Rs 41,000 crore in Dec, debt funds saw outflows of Rs 1.27 lakh crore - The Economic Times
summary:
Equity MF inflows rose 15% to Rs 41,000 crore in Dec, debt funds saw outflows of Rs 1.27 lakh crore

Publication Date: December 2024

Source: Economic Times

The mutual fund industry recorded a net outflow of Rs 80,509 crore in December 2024, along with an impressive 15% month-on-month increase in equity mutual fund inflows, reaching Rs 41,155 crore.

  • Equity mutual funds saw inflows rise from Rs 35,943 crore in November to Rs 41,155 crore in December.
  • Sectoral and thematic funds attracted the highest inflows totaling Rs 15,331 crore.
  • In CY24, equity mutual funds had total inflows of Rs 3.94 lakh crore.
  • Debt funds experienced a notable outflow of Rs 1.27 lakh crore.
  • Hybrid mutual funds saw a 6% increase in inflows, reaching Rs 4,369 crore.
  • The overall assets under management (AUM) decreased by 2% to Rs 66.66 lakh crore in December.
“Liquid funds observed the highest outflow in December, amounting to Rs 66,532 crore.”

In conclusion, while equity mutual funds demonstrated strong growth in December, the debt segment faced significant withdrawals, highlighting varied investor confidence in different fund categories.
newTitle: Equity MF Inflows Rise 15% to Rs 41,000 Crore in December
